Adult Immunization Status: Influenza.description: The percentage of members who are up to date on recommended routine influenza vaccines.
methods_to_close_gap: Claim
Upload to Novillus Care Gap Management Application (CGMA)
best_practices: Educate patients on the importance of the annual influenza vaccine and provide informational resources.
Host flu vaccine clinics in the fall to increase accessibility.
Notify patients when flu vaccines are available and encourage scheduling an appointment.
Advise patients to inform their PCP if they receive the vaccine at an external location (e.g., pharmacy, community clinic).
Adult Immunization Status: Influenza.summary_of_changes_2025: Transitioned from a display measure to an incentive measure in 2025.

Appropriate Treatment for Upper Respirat.description: The percentage of episodes for members with a diagnosis of upper respiratory infection (URI) that did not result in an antibiotic dispensing event.
denominator_exclusions: competing diagnosis on or within 3 days of the episode
methods_to_close_gap: No antibiotic prescribed unless a comorbid/competing diagnosis is present
best_practices: Educate patients on proper hand hygiene and hygiene to prevent URI.
Explain that most URIs are viral and do not require antibiotics.
Recommend symptom relief methods such as rest and fluids.

Asthma Medication Ratio.description: The percentage of members with persistent asthma who had a ratio of controller medications to total asthma medications of 0.50 or greater.
denominator_exclusions: other respiratory diseases requiring different treatments
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a medication ratio of ≥0.50 by increasing controller medication usage
best_practices: Ensure patients understand the difference between controller and reliever medications.
Encourage proper inhaler technique and adherence.
Consider 90-day prescriptions and automatic refills for controller medications.
Asthma Medication Ratio.summary_of_changes_2025: Added albuterol-budesonide as an asthma reliever medication.

description: The percentage of members 40–74 years of age who were recommended for routine breast cancer screening and had a mammogram to screen for breast cancer.
Mammogram every 2 years: One or more mammograms any time on or between Oct. 1 two years prior to the measurement period and the end of the measurement period.
Breast Cancer Screening.measurement_period: January 1, 2025 - December 31, 2025; but actually looking back 2 years
denominator_exclusions: bilateral mastectomy or absence of both breasts
gender-affirming chest surgery with gender dysphoria diagnosis
frailty and advanced illness in members 66 years or older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one mammogram within the required timeframe
best_practices: Set provider-patient reminders to discuss breast cancer screening annually.
Offer convenient scheduling options, including weekend or walk-in appointments.
Send reminder letters and follow-up phone calls to patients due for screening.
Address logistical barriers such as transportation or childcare support.
Breast Cancer Screening.summary_of_changes_2025: Added a laboratory claim exclusion to the Absence of Left Value Set and Absence of Right Breast Value Set.

Cervical Cancer Screening.description: The percentage of members recommended for routine cervical cancer screening who had an appropriate screening test performed within the specified time frame.
denominator_exclusions: cervical agenesis or acquired absence of cervix
sex assigned at birth as male
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure cervical cytology every three years or HPV testing every five years
best_practices: Leverage Electronic Medical Records (EMR) to identify patients due for screening.
Encourage in-office Pap testing when possible.
Educate patients about the importance of cervical cancer screening.
Cervical Cancer Screening.summary_of_changes_2025: The measure is now reported using Electronic Clinical Data Systems (ECDS).

Chlamydia Screening.description: The percentage of members recommended for routine chlamydia screening who were identified as sexually active and had at least one test for chlamydia during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: sex assigned at birth as male
pregnancy test with isotretinoin or diagnostic imaging
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one chlamydia test during the measurement year
best_practices: Normalize chlamydia screening as routine care for sexually active individuals.
Offer urine-based testing in-office to ensure completion.
Educate patients about asymptomatic infections and long-term complications.
Ensure appropriate coding to minimize out-of-pocket costs for patients.
Chlamydia Screening.summary_of_changes_2025: Updated the measure title from 'Chlamydia Screening in Women' to 'Chlamydia Screening'. Expanded eligibility criteria.

description: The percentage of members 45–75 years of age who had appropriate screening for colorectal cancer:
Fecal occult blood test (FOBT Lab Test Value Set; FOBT Test Result or Finding Value Set) during the measurement period.
Stool DNA (sDNA) with FIT test (sDNA FIT Lab Test Value Set) during the measurement period or the 2 years prior to the measurement period.
Flexible sigmoidoscopy (Flexible Sigmoidoscopy Value Set) during the measurement period or the 4 years prior to the measurement period.

CT colonography (CT Colonography Value Set) during the measurement period or the 4 years prior to the measurement period. Note that CT colonography may not be a covered service, but will close the quality gap in care.
Colonoscopy (Colonoscopy Value Set) during the measurement period or the 9 years prior to the measurement period.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness in members 66 years or older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one colorectal cancer screening within the appropriate timeframe
best_practices: Offer multiple screening options to improve patient compliance.
Use electronic health record (EHR) alerts to identify overdue patients.
Encourage FIT testing as a less invasive alternative when patients decline colonoscopy.
Ensure staff provide clear instructions on FIT kit use and return.
Colorectal Cancer Screening.summary_of_changes_2025: New incentive measure for UPMC for You (Medicaid).

Concurrent Use of Opioids and Benzodiaze.description: The percentage of individuals who did not have concurrent use of prescription opioids and benzodiazepines.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent opioid and benzodiazepine use for ≥ 30 days
best_practices: Avoid prescribing benzodiazepines when opioids are already prescribed.
If tapering is necessary, create an individualized tapering plan for the patient.
Monitor patients with multiple sedative prescriptions and explore alternative treatments.
Encourage non-pharmacologic options for anxiety and pain management.

Controlling High Blood Pressure.description: The percentage of members who had a diagnosis of hypertension (HTN) and whose blood pressure (BP) was adequately controlled (<140/90 mm Hg) during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness in members 66 years or older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure the most recent BP reading is <140/90 mm Hg
best_practices: Educate patients on the importance of lifestyle changes for blood pressure control.
Encourage medication adherence for patients with hypertension.
Recheck elevated BP readings after allowing the patient to sit and relax.
Use electronic health records (EHR) to track and manage hypertensive patients.

Depression Screening.description: The percentage of members who had a depression screening during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: members who die during the measurement year
Premier Partners Program participants are ineligible for the Quality Partners Program incentive.
methods_to_close_gap: Submit depression screening result codes (G8431, G8510, G8511, G8940, G0444, 96127)
best_practices: Use Electronic Medical Records (EMR) to track screenings and ensure results are submitted.
Implement standardized two-step screening: initial brief screen followed by a more detailed questionnaire if positive.
Offer follow-up interventions including counseling, medications, or specialty referrals.

Eye Exam for Patients with Diabetes.description: The percentage of members with diabetes (types 1 and 2) who had a retinal eye exam.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness in members 66 years or older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a retinal or dilated eye exam within the measurement year
best_practices: Educate patients on the importance of diabetic retinal screenings.
Provide on-site retinal imaging and ensure results are interpreted by an eye care professional.
Develop relationships with local eye care providers to improve patient access.
Use patient reminders via email, phone, or text for scheduling.
Eye Exam for Patients with Diabetes.summary_of_changes_2025: Moved bilateral eye enucleation from numerator to required exclusions.

Follow-Up After Emergency Department Vis.description: The percentage of emergency department (ED) visits for members with multiple high-risk chronic conditions who had a follow-up service within 7 days of the ED visit.
denominator_exclusions: ED visits resulting in inpatient admission
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure follow-up service within 7 days after an ED visit
best_practices: Develop a process to identify ED visits and coordinate timely follow-up.
Educate patients to notify the PCP office when discharged from the ED.
Schedule follow-up visits before ED discharge whenever possible.
Use dedicated care managers to assist patients in coordinating follow-up care.
Follow-Up After Emergency Department Vis.summary_of_changes_2025: Added a laboratory claim exclusion to a value set.

Glycemic Status Assessment for Patients.description: The percentage of members with diabetes (types 1 and 2) whose most recent glycemic status (hemoglobin A1c [HbA1c] or glucose management indicator [GMI]) was controlled during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness for members 66 and older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure HbA1c < 8.0% for Commercial and Medicaid members
best_practices: Submit CPT II codes or upload results where no lab feed exists.
Identify members who would benefit from diabetes education programs.
Use continuous glucose monitoring for more accurate assessment.

Glycemic Status Assessment for Patients.description: The percentage of members with diabetes (types 1 and 2) whose most recent glycemic status (hemoglobin A1c [HbA1c] or glucose management indicator [GMI]) was controlled during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness for members 66 and older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure HbA1c < 9.0% for Medicare members
best_practices: Submit CPT II codes or upload results where no lab feed exists.
Identify members who would benefit from diabetes education programs.
Use continuous glucose monitoring for more accurate assessment.

Kidney Health Evaluation for Patients wi.description: The percentage of members with diabetes (type 1 and type 2) who received a kidney health evaluation, defined by an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and a urine albumin-creatinine ratio (uACR), during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness for members 66 and older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure both an eGFR and a uACR test during the measurement year
best_practices: Ensure urine specimen collection is available at the practice.
Educate patients on the importance of routine kidney health evaluation.
Use electronic alerts to remind providers of necessary screenings.

Medication Adherence for Diabetes.description: The percentage of individuals who met the Proportion of Days Covered (PDC) threshold of 80% for diabetes medications during the measurement year.
Medication Adherence for Diabetes.ages: 18 years and older for Quality Partners Program; 22 years and older for Premier Partners Program
denominator_exclusions: hospice care at any time during the measurement year
end-stage renal disease (ESRD) diagnosis at any time during the measurement year
one or more prescription claims for insulin during the treatment period
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the treatment period
best_practices: Urge patients to use UPMC ID cards to fill prescriptions - many formulary medications are available at no cost share at preferred pharmacies
Encourage 100-day prescription fills for UPMC for Life (Medicare/SNP) members
Ensure pharmacy receives updated prescriptions when medication doses or instructions change
Recommend use of UPMC Health Plan-preferred pharmacies
Encourage automatic refills and use of a pill box to maintain adherence
Use medication samples before sending prescriptions to determine tolerance

Medication Adherence for Cholesterol (St.description: The percentage of individuals who met the Proportion of Days Covered (PDC) threshold of 80% for statins during the measurement year.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the measurement year
best_practices: Encourage patients to use UPMC-preferred pharmacies.
Recommend 100-day prescription fills to improve adherence.
Ensure medication changes are updated with pharmacies to avoid gaps in adherence.

Medication Adherence for Hypertension (R.description: The percentage of individuals who met the Proportion of Days Covered (PDC) threshold of 80% for RAS antagonists during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: prescription for sacubitril/valsartan during the treatment period
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a proportion of days covered (PDC) threshold of 80% during the treatment period
best_practices: Encourage 100-day prescription fills to improve adherence.
Ensure the pharmacy receives updated prescriptions when doses change.
Recommend automatic refills and use of a pill organizer to maintain adherence.

Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge.description: The percentage of discharges for members who had documentation of medication reconciliation within 30 days after discharge.
denominator_exclusions: member deceased during the measurement year
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure medication reconciliation by a prescribing practitioner, pharmacist, PA, or nurse within 30 days post-discharge
best_practices: Perform medication reconciliation via phone or in-person within a week of discharge.
Ask patients to bring all medications to their follow-up visit to ensure accuracy.
Update the patient's medication list in their health record to prevent discrepancies.

Patient Engagement After Inpatient Disch.description: The percentage of discharges for members who had documentation of patient engagement within 30 days after discharge.
denominator_exclusions: member deceased during the measurement year
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure patient engagement through outpatient visits, telephone visits, e-visits, or virtual check-ins within 30 days post-discharge
best_practices: Use Admission, Discharge, Transfer (ADT) reports to identify patients needing follow-up.
Perform outreach within two weeks if a follow-up visit is not scheduled.
Address transportation barriers by offering telehealth or virtual check-ins.
Patient Engagement After Inpatient Disch.summary_of_changes_2025: New display measure for Commercial and UPMC for You (Medicaid).

Pharmacotherapy Management of COPD: Bron.description: The percentage of COPD exacerbations for members 40 years of age and older who had an acute inpatient discharge or ED visit and were dispensed a bronchodilator within 30 days of the event.
denominator_exclusions: member deceased during the measurement year
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure a bronchodilator prescription is dispensed within 30 days of a COPD-related hospital or ED visit
best_practices: Follow up with COPD patients within five days post-discharge to confirm medication adherence.
Ensure inhaler technique training is provided to improve medication effectiveness.
Encourage early refill requests to prevent medication gaps.

Plan All-Cause Readmissions.description: For members who meet the age criteria, the number of acute inpatient and observation stays during the measurement year that were followed by an unplanned acute readmission for any diagnosis within 30 days and the predicted probability of an acute readmission.
denominator_exclusions: hospital stay where the index admission date equals the index discharge date
hospital stay where the member died
principal diagnosis of pregnancy or perinatal conditions
methods_to_close_gap: Prevent readmissions through proper discharge planning and post-hospital follow-up
best_practices: Use Admission, Discharge, Transfer (ADT) reports to identify recently discharged patients.
Ensure all patients receive follow-up care after hospital discharge.
Address common causes of readmission at follow-up visits, such as medication reconciliation and symptom management.

Polypharmacy: Use of Multiple Anticholin.description: The percentage of individuals 65 years of age and older who do not have concurrent use of two or more unique anticholinergic medications.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent use for ≥ 30 cumulative days of ≥ 2 unique anticholinergic medications
best_practices: Avoid prescribing multiple anticholinergic medications when clinically unnecessary.
Consider alternative agents with fewer cognitive side effects for older adults.
Periodically reassess the need for anticholinergic medications and deprescribe when appropriate.
Polypharmacy: Use of Multiple Anticholin.summary_of_changes_2025: Transitioned from a display measure to an incentive measure.

Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiov.description: The percentage of members who were identified as having clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) and who were dispensed at least one high-intensity or moderate-intensity statin medication during the measurement year.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one dispensing event for a high-intensity or moderate-intensity statin medication
best_practices: Ensure all ASCVD patients are prescribed a moderate or high-intensity statin.
Assess statin intolerance and consider alternative dosing schedules for patients with muscle symptoms.
Encourage medication adherence through patient education and cost-saving programs.
Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiov.summary_of_changes_2025: Added a required exclusion for muscular reactions to statins.

description: The percentage of members 40-75 years of age during the measurement year with diabetes who do not have clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) who were dispensed at least one statin medication of any intensity during the measurement year.
DM is defined as being prescribed a DM medication or having the diagnosis of DMx2 in the chart.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one dispensing event for a high-intensity, moderate-intensity, or low-intensity statin medication
best_practices: Prescribe statins for all eligible patients with diabetes regardless of lipid levels.
Encourage adherence through education and reminders.
Use formulary-preferred statins to minimize cost barriers.
Monitor for statin side effects and adjust regimens accordingly.
Statin Therapy for Patients with Diabete.summary_of_changes_2025: Added a required exclusion for muscular reactions to statins.

Statin Use in Persons with Diabetes.description: The percentage of members 40-75 years old who were dispensed at least two diabetes medication fills and received a statin medication fill during the measurement period.
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure patients receiving diabetes medications are also prescribed a statin
best_practices: Ensure all eligible diabetes patients are prescribed a statin per ADA/AHA guidelines.
Check adherence and refill status during patient visits.
Educate providers on the importance of statin use in diabetes management.
Monitor for potential statin intolerance and adjust therapy if needed.

7-Day Follow-Up for Inpatient Discharge.description: The percentage of inpatient discharges for members 22 years of age and older who had documentation of patient engagement (e.g., office visits, visits to the home, telehealth) provided within 7 days after discharge.
denominator_exclusions: patient deceased during the measurement year
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure an outpatient visit, telehealth visit, or home visit within 7 days post-discharge
best_practices: Utilize ADT reports to identify patients needing follow-up.
Conduct outreach to patients within two weeks if a follow-up is not scheduled.
Address transportation barriers by offering telehealth follow-up.
7-Day Follow-Up for Inpatient Discharge.source: NCQA, HEDIS MY 2025 TRC specs; UPMC Health Plan
7-Day Follow-Up for Inpatient Discharge.summary_of_changes_2025: Observation stays were removed from the denominator for this measure.

Adult Immunization Status: Pneumococcal.description: The percentage of members 65 years of age and older who are up to date on recommended routine pneumococcal vaccine.
denominator_exclusions: member deceased during the measurement period
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure at least one dose of an adult pneumococcal vaccine on or after the 19th birthday
best_practices: Educate patients on the importance of routine vaccines with supporting research and resources.
Ensure vaccine availability at primary care locations to increase uptake.

Blood Pressure Control for Patients with.description: The percentage of members with diabetes (types 1 and 2) whose blood pressure (BP) was adequately controlled (<140/90 mm Hg) during the measurement year.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness for members 66 and older
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure the most recent BP reading is <140/90 mm Hg
best_practices: Educate patients on the impact of diet, exercise, and stress management on blood pressure.
Recheck elevated BP readings after allowing the patient to sit and relax.
Encourage adherence to antihypertensive medications and lifestyle modifications.

Depression Screening and Follow-Up: Foll.description: The percentage of members who were screened for clinical depression using a standardized instrument and, if screened positive, received follow-up care within 30 days of the positive screen finding.
denominator_exclusions: member deceased during the measurement period
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure follow-up care within 30 days of a positive depression screen
best_practices: Use validated screening tools and ensure positive results lead to follow-up care.
Establish workflows for rapid access to mental health services.
Incorporate depression screening into routine primary care visits.
Depression Screening and Follow-Up: Foll.source: NCQA, HEDIS MY 2025, UPMC Health Plan
Depression Screening and Follow-Up: Foll.summary_of_changes_2025: New display measure in 2025 primary care incentive programs.

Initial Opioid Prescribing for Long Dura.description: The percentage of members who did not receive an initial opioid prescription exceeding 7 cumulative days' supply.
methods_to_close_gap: Limit initial opioid prescriptions to ≥ 7 days' supply
best_practices: Limit opioid prescriptions to the lowest effective dose and duration.
Encourage non-opioid pain management options.
Initial Opioid Prescribing for Long Dura.summary_of_changes_2025: New display measure in 2025 for UPMC for Life (Medicare/SNP).

Osteoporosis Management in Women Who Had.description: The percentage of women 67–85 years of age who suffered a fracture and who had either a bone mineral density (BMD) test or prescription for a drug to treat osteoporosis in the 180 days (six months) after the fracture.
denominator_exclusions: frailty and advanced illness in members 67-80 years old
members with a prior BMD test or osteoporosis medication in the past 365 days
methods_to_close_gap: Ensure BMD test or osteoporosis therapy within 180 days post-fracture
best_practices: Encourage fall prevention strategies to reduce fracture risk.
Ensure patients with fractures receive osteoporosis therapy or BMD testing within six months.
Educate patients on the importance of osteoporosis screening and treatment.

Unplanned Care Utilization.description: Data not yet available - This measure tracks the rate of unplanned care utilization that could potentially be prevented through effective outpatient care, disease management, and care coordination.
methods_to_close_gap: Data not yet available
best_practices: Data not yet available

Polypharmacy: Use of Multiple CNS-Active.description: The percentage of individuals 65 years of age and older who do not have concurrent use of three or more unique central nervous system (CNS)-active medications.
methods_to_close_gap: No concurrent use for ≥ 30 cumulative days of ≥ 3 unique CNS-active medications
best_practices: Limit unnecessary polypharmacy in elderly patients.
Perform medication reconciliation regularly to identify potential overuse of CNS-active medications.
Evaluate patients for deprescribing opportunities where appropriate.
